title: 111_s3973
content: The Act titled "Diesel Emissions Reduction Act of 2010" establishes a program to reduce diesel emissions. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include definitions for entities that can sell or upgrade diesel vehicles and equipment. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include definitions for entities that can sell or upgrade diesel vehicles and equipment, including private individuals or entities with contracts with federal departments or agencies. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include definitions for entities that can sell or upgrade diesel vehicles and equipment, including private individuals or entities with contracts with federal departments or agencies. Administrator may establish use of vehicles purchased or retrofitted using grants, rebates, or loans. Redesignated paragraphs and inclusion of State definitions. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include grants, contracts, rebates, or low-cost loans for eligible entities to sell or upgrade diesel vehicles and equipment. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include changes in subsections (b) and (c), such as redesignating paragraphs and updating numerical values. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include a simplified application process for expedited provision of funds for all applicants. Special considerations for small fleet owners and potential requirement for competitive bids in applications. Eligibility criteria are also outlined. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include a simplified application process for expedited provision of funds for equipment and installation. Eligibility criteria for grants, rebates, and low-cost loans are outlined for eligible entities. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include a simplified application process for expedited provision of funds for equipment and installation. Amendments include changes to subparagraphs regarding diesel fleets, construction sites, and schools. Subsections (F) and (G) are removed. Amendments include inserting "rebate" after "grant" in various subsections and paragraphs. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to prioritize projects meeting specific criteria for grants, rebates, and loans. States must publish descriptions of awarded applications within 60 days. Evaluation sections are updated to include "rebate" after "grant," and authorization of appropriations is addressed. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to prioritize projects meeting specific criteria for grants, rebates, and loans. Authorization of appropriations is addressed. Authorization of appropriations is set at $200,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2012 through 2016 under the Energy Policy Act of 2005. The Administrator can allocate up to 1 percent of the funds for management and oversight.
